acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=0.53mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2004).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >5,000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1978)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation route) value of 2.5mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1992)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of >5,000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1978)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no evidence of treatment-related incidence of tumor formation observed in mouse carcinogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (log Kow=3.9(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), since there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point: 117.5-118.5degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)).

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data in in vivo assays, though negative results were obtained in in vitro assays (reverse mutation tests and chromosome aberration tests) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1978, 1988)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine and oxygen (but not fluorine), with the chlorine and oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on parental reproduction and offspring development observed in rat 2-generation reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1978, 1986)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test method applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 117.5-118.5degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data), test temperature: 140degC).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though being sulfonyls, containing chemical groups with self-reactive properties.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on no evidence of irritation observed in rabbit eye irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1978)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of mild reversible irritation observed in rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1978)).

skin_sensitizer.rationale: No skin sensitizing potential was found in guinea pig sensitization tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (genitalia)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "reduced relative weights of the ovary and womb," "endometrial atrophy" (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1978)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
